meanings.definition: To change the structure or form of (something)
meanings.sent1: She decided to remodel her bedroom by painting the walls a new color.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to remodel their website to make it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent3: After a few failed attempts, they finally managed to remodel the old chair into a stylish new one.
meanings.sent4: His journey through the mountains seemed to remodel his perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to magically remodel the blank canvas into a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To give a new shape or form to (something)
meanings.sent1: The sculptor used clay to remodel the figure into a more dynamic pose.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer decided to remodel the dress to better fit the model.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remodel the cookie dough into a perfect circle turned into a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to remodel the somber atmosphere into one of joy and lightness.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds seemed to remodel the landscape overnight, leaving a new scene in the morning.

meanings.definition: To renovate or improve (a building or room)
meanings.sent1: They hired a contractor to remodel their kitchen and make it more modern.
meanings.sent2: The hotel decided to remodel the lobby to create a more welcoming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to remodel the old clock with glitter ended up looking quite sparkly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to remodel the relationship, making it stronger and more resilient.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to remodel the room, filling it with energy and excitement.
